original_title: Sri Lanka stocks rise marginal 0.07-pct, S&P SL20 dips
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Colombo’s All Share Price Index (ASPI) rose marginally higher by 0.07 percent while the S&P SL20 declined, data on its site showed.
The ASPI rose 14.34 points from Monday to 19,532.20; while the S&P SL20 index ended 0.38 percent, or 22.05 points weaker, to close at 5,752.46.
Turnover increased to 7.5 billion rupees from 6.1 billion rupees; while the share volume was 221,201,482.

The ASPI was pushed up by ACL Cables which ended 10.75 rupees stronger at 177.75; Melstacorp which rose 2 rupees to 154.00 rupees; Hayleys which ended 2.25 rupees up at 179.75 rupees; Central Finance Company which moved 3.75 rupees up to 307.75; and Cargills (Ceylon) which closed 11.50 rupees higher at 600.
Japan’s Nikkei 225 index declined 0.79 percent, or 323.72 points, to 40,674.55.

“Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba insists on remaining in office despite calls within his party for him to step down following the ruling coalition’s major setback in the latest national election,” Japan’s The Mainichi newspaper said.
Pakistan Foreign Minister Ishaq Dar said that the US and Pakistan are “very close” to a trade deal.
However, Pakistan’s KSE 100 index was trading 0.84 percent lower at 138,208.05.
Meanwhile India’s Nifty 50 rose 0.57 percent to 24,821.10, while the BSE Sensex was 0.55 percent higher at 81,337.95.
As at 3.50 pm Sri Lankan time, spot gold was trading at 3,338.22 US dollars, up 16.34 US dollars. (Colombo/Jul29/2025)
